trans-unit.source: ACS Management Service
trans-unit.target: ACS Management Service

trans-unit.source: Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure

trans-unit.source: ACS Management Service
trans-unit.target: ACS Management Service

trans-unit.source: Applies to
trans-unit.target: Applies to

trans-unit.source: Summary
trans-unit.target: Summary

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service is an <token>secondref_acs</token> component that allows you to manage and configure the settings in an <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> programmatically.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service is an <token>secondref_acs</token> component that allows you to manage and configure the settings in an <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> programmatically.

trans-unit.source: You can use the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service as an alternative or complement to the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, which provides a graphic user interface for <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service as an alternative or complement to the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, which provides a graphic user interface for <token>secondref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: This topic explains the following:
trans-unit.target: This topic explains the following:

trans-unit.source: How the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service fits into the overall <token>secondref_acs</token> architecture
trans-unit.target: How the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service fits into the overall <token>secondref_acs</token> architecture

trans-unit.source: When it is appropriate to use the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service to configure <token>secondref_acs</token> settings
trans-unit.target: When it is appropriate to use the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service to configure <token>secondref_acs</token> settings

trans-unit.source: How to use the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service most effectively
trans-unit.target: How to use the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service most effectively

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: You can use the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service and Open Data (OData) protocol to manage and configure the <token>secondref_acs</token> components in an <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> programmatically.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service and Open Data (OData) protocol to manage and configure the <token>secondref_acs</token> components in an <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> programmatically.

trans-unit.source: The following diagram illustrates the components of <token>secondref_acs</token> and their relationships.
trans-unit.target: The following diagram illustrates the components of <token>secondref_acs</token> and their relationships.

trans-unit.source: Programmatic management can be especially effective in scenarios like the following ones.
trans-unit.target: Programmatic management can be especially effective in scenarios like the following ones.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold><embeddedLabel>Adding new tenants to an SaaS service</embeddedLabel></legacyBold> If you have a software-as-a-service product, such as Office 365, you can write code that runs whenever a new customer signs up for your service.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold><embeddedLabel>Adding new tenants to an SaaS service</embeddedLabel></legacyBold> If you have a software-as-a-service product, such as Office 365, you can write code that runs whenever a new customer signs up for your service.

trans-unit.source: The code works with the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service to configure the new tenant for the identity provider that they select.
trans-unit.target: The code works with the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service to configure the new tenant for the identity provider that they select.

trans-unit.source: For a working sample of SaaS application source code that adds new tenants to <token>secondref_acs</token>, see <externalLink><linkText>http://www.fabrikamshipping.com/</linkText><linkUri>http://www.fabrikamshipping.com/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For a working sample of SaaS application source code that adds new tenants to <token>secondref_acs</token>, see <externalLink><linkText>http://www.fabrikamshipping.com/</linkText><linkUri>http://www.fabrikamshipping.com/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Deploying solutions</embeddedLabel>—When deploying new solutions, you can add a custom task to configure <token>secondref_acs</token> as part of the deployment.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Deploying solutions</embeddedLabel>—When deploying new solutions, you can add a custom task to configure <token>secondref_acs</token> as part of the deployment.

trans-unit.source: The <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service can help you automate the deployment and minimize manual configuration tasks after the application is deployed.
trans-unit.target: The <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service can help you automate the deployment and minimize manual configuration tasks after the application is deployed.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Custom user interface</embeddedLabel>—You can use the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, a web-based user interface that is hosted on its own domain, to manage and configure <token>secondref_acs</token> components.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Custom user interface</embeddedLabel>—You can use the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, a web-based user interface that is hosted on its own domain, to manage and configure <token>secondref_acs</token> components.

trans-unit.source: However, if the user interface is rebranded, embedded into a larger management console, or exposed through non-web-based user interface, you can use the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service to manage and configure your <token>secondref_acs</token> settings.
trans-unit.target: However, if the user interface is rebranded, embedded into a larger management console, or exposed through non-web-based user interface, you can use the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service to manage and configure your <token>secondref_acs</token> settings.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Additional features</embeddedLabel> Although most tasks can be performed in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, some are available only by using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Additional features</embeddedLabel> Although most tasks can be performed in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, some are available only by using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can add custom OpenID identity providers only by using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can add custom OpenID identity providers only by using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service.

trans-unit.source: Accessing the ACS 2.0 Management Service
trans-unit.target: Accessing the ACS 2.0 Management Service

trans-unit.source: To access the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service for a particular <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>, you must provide the Management Service endpoint URL to the OData client.
trans-unit.target: To access the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service for a particular <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>, you must provide the Management Service endpoint URL to the OData client.

trans-unit.source: To find the Management Service endpoint URL for an <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>, use the following procedure.
trans-unit.target: To find the Management Service endpoint URL for an <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>, use the following procedure.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Management service</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Management service</ui>.

trans-unit.source: The URL appears in the <ui>Management Service URL</ui> section of the page.
trans-unit.target: The URL appears in the <ui>Management Service URL</ui> section of the page.

trans-unit.source: The format for an endpoint URL is <ui>https://<Namespace>.accesscontrol.windows.net/v2/mgmt/service</ui> where <placeholder>Namespace</placeholder> is the name of your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: The format for an endpoint URL is <ui>https://<Namespace>.accesscontrol.windows.net/v2/mgmt/service</ui> where <placeholder>Namespace</placeholder> is the name of your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: The <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service uses <token>secondref_acs</token> for authentication.
trans-unit.target: The <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service uses <token>secondref_acs</token> for authentication.

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> accepts a management credential issued in OAuth WRAP protocol and, in response, <token>secondref</token> issues a SWT token to the client.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> accepts a management credential issued in OAuth WRAP protocol and, in response, <token>secondref</token> issues a SWT token to the client.

trans-unit.source: The SWT token is required for access to the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service.
trans-unit.target: The SWT token is required for access to the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service.

trans-unit.source: Use any of the following types of account credentials to authenticate to the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service:
trans-unit.target: Use any of the following types of account credentials to authenticate to the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Passwords</embeddedLabel>—Use OAuth WRAP protocol to send a password in a plaintext token request to <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Passwords</embeddedLabel>—Use OAuth WRAP protocol to send a password in a plaintext token request to <token>secondref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: The password field corresponds to the <system>wrap_password</system> parameter in an OAuth WRAP v0.9 token request and the username field corresponds to the <system>wrap_name</system> parameter.
trans-unit.target: The password field corresponds to the <system>wrap_password</system> parameter in an OAuth WRAP v0.9 token request and the username field corresponds to the <system>wrap_name</system> parameter.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see "Password token requests" in <link xlink:href="c735424a-3def-46ee-a9a1-846753e45ea0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How To: Request a Token from ACS via the OAuth WRAP Protocol</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see "Password token requests" in <link xlink:href="c735424a-3def-46ee-a9a1-846753e45ea0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How To: Request a Token from ACS via the OAuth WRAP Protocol</link>.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Symmetric Keys</embeddedLabel>—Use a symmetric key to sign a SWT token and then use the OAuth WRAP protocol to send the token to <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Symmetric Keys</embeddedLabel>—Use a symmetric key to sign a SWT token and then use the OAuth WRAP protocol to send the token to <token>secondref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the "SWT token requests" in <link xlink:href="c735424a-3def-46ee-a9a1-846753e45ea0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How To: Request a Token from ACS via the OAuth WRAP Protocol</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the "SWT token requests" in <link xlink:href="c735424a-3def-46ee-a9a1-846753e45ea0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How To: Request a Token from ACS via the OAuth WRAP Protocol</link>.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>X.509 Certificates</embeddedLabel>—Use an X.509 certificate to validate the signature of a SAML bearer token sent to <token>secondref_acs</token> for authentication.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>X.509 Certificates</embeddedLabel>—Use an X.509 certificate to validate the signature of a SAML bearer token sent to <token>secondref_acs</token> for authentication.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see "SAML token requests" in <link xlink:href="c735424a-3def-46ee-a9a1-846753e45ea0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How To: Request a Token from ACS via the OAuth WRAP Protocol</link>
trans-unit.target: For more information, see "SAML token requests" in <link xlink:href="c735424a-3def-46ee-a9a1-846753e45ea0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How To: Request a Token from ACS via the OAuth WRAP Protocol</link>

trans-unit.source: You can add and configure management service accounts with all of these credential types in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: You can add and configure management service accounts with all of these credential types in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="07b7daf4-b4d6-48fc-b921-3b1e63d44f61" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS 2.0 Management Portal</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="07b7daf4-b4d6-48fc-b921-3b1e63d44f61" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS 2.0 Management Portal</link>.

trans-unit.source: ACS 2.0 Management Service data entities
trans-unit.target: ACS 2.0 Management Service data entities

trans-unit.source: An entity data model organizes configuration data into records of <newTerm>entity types</newTerm> (or <newTerm>entities</newTerm>) and the associations between them.
trans-unit.target: An entity data model organizes configuration data into records of <newTerm>entity types</newTerm> (or <newTerm>entities</newTerm>) and the associations between them.

trans-unit.source: The data model for each <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> is described in the OData Service Metadata Document available at: <ui>https://<namespace>.accesscontrol.windows.net/v2/mgmt/service/$metadata</ui>, where <placeholder><namespace></placeholder> is the name of the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: The data model for each <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> is described in the OData Service Metadata Document available at: <ui>https://<namespace>.accesscontrol.windows.net/v2/mgmt/service/$metadata</ui>, where <placeholder><namespace></placeholder> is the name of the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: This XML document uses conceptual schema definition language (CSDL) to describe the entity module.
trans-unit.target: This XML document uses conceptual schema definition language (CSDL) to describe the entity module.

trans-unit.source: You can download this document and use it to generate typed classes in your code.
trans-unit.target: You can download this document and use it to generate typed classes in your code.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the <token>secondref_acs</token> entity types and their properties, see <link xlink:href="9e564703-0a93-4ebe-8035-a5b8b54f57e9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS Management Service API Reference</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the <token>secondref_acs</token> entity types and their properties, see <link xlink:href="9e564703-0a93-4ebe-8035-a5b8b54f57e9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS Management Service API Reference</link>.

trans-unit.source: Default Entity Data
trans-unit.target: Default Entity Data

trans-unit.source: Every <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> contains default configuration data that is exposed to the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service, but is not available in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Every <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> contains default configuration data that is exposed to the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service, but is not available in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: This configuration data is typically used internally by the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> and is not related to custom relying party applications.
trans-unit.target: This configuration data is typically used internally by the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> and is not related to custom relying party applications.

trans-unit.source: This data includes:
trans-unit.target: This data includes:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>AccessControlManagement Relying Party Application</embeddedLabel>—Represents the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal and the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service, which are relying parties of the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>AccessControlManagement Relying Party Application</embeddedLabel>—Represents the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal and the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service, which are relying parties of the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>AccessControlManagement Rule Group and Rules</embeddedLabel>—Contains the access rules for the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal and the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>AccessControlManagement Rule Group and Rules</embeddedLabel>—Contains the access rules for the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal and the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service.

trans-unit.source: You can configure the rules and rule groups in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: You can configure the rules and rule groups in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel><token>windows_live_id</token> Identity Provider and Issuer</embeddedLabel>—Represents <token>ms_acct</token>, the default identity provider and issuer.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel><token>windows_live_id</token> Identity Provider and Issuer</embeddedLabel>—Represents <token>ms_acct</token>, the default identity provider and issuer.

trans-unit.source: This identity provider cannot be deleted, because it is used by the <system>AccessControlManagement</system> relying party for authentication to the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: This identity provider cannot be deleted, because it is used by the <system>AccessControlManagement</system> relying party for authentication to the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>LOCAL_AUTHORITY Issuer</embeddedLabel>—Issuer used in the <token>secondref_acs</token> rules engine for claims output by <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>LOCAL_AUTHORITY Issuer</embeddedLabel>—Issuer used in the <token>secondref_acs</token> rules engine for claims output by <token>secondref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: http://www.fabrikamshipping.com/
